questions.q0: Oppression by corporations is more of a concern than oppression by governments.
questions.q1: It is necessary for the government to intervene in the economy to protect consumers.
questions.q2: The freer the markets, the freer the people.
questions.q3: It is better to maintain a balanced budget than to ensure welfare for all citizens.
questions.q4: Publicly-funded research is more beneficial to the people than leaving it to the market.
questions.q5: Tariffs on international trade are important to encourage local production.
questions.q6: From each according to his ability, to each according to his needs.
questions.q7: It would be best if social programs were abolished in favor of private charity.
questions.q8: Taxes should be increased on the rich to provide for the poor.
questions.q9: Inheritance is a legitimate form of wealth.
questions.q10: Basic utilities like roads and electricity should be publicly owned.
questions.q11: Government intervention is a threat to the economy.
questions.q12: Those with a greater ability to pay should receive better healthcare.
questions.q13: Quality education is a right of all people.
questions.q14: The means of production should belong to the workers who use them.
questions.q15: The United Nations should be abolished.
questions.q16: Military action by our nation is often necessary to protect it.
questions.q17: I support regional unions, such as the European Union.
questions.q18: It is important to maintain our national sovereignty.
questions.q19: A united world government would be beneficial to mankind.
questions.q20: It is more important to retain peaceful relations than to further our strength.
questions.q21: Wars do not need to be justified to other countries.
questions.q22: Military spending is a waste of money.
questions.q23: International aid is a waste of money.
questions.q25: Research should be conducted on an international scale.
questions.q26: Governments should be accountable to the international community.
questions.q27: Even when protesting an authoritarian government, violence is not acceptable.
questions.q28: My religious values should be spread as much as possible.
questions.q29: Our nation's values should be spread as much as possible.
questions.q30: It is very important to maintain law and order.
questions.q31: The general populace makes poor decisions.
questions.q33: The sacrifice of some civil liberties is necessary to protect us from acts of terrorism.
questions.q34: Government surveillance is necessary in the modern world.
questions.q35: The very existence of the state is a threat to our liberty.
questions.q36: Regardless of political opinions, it is important to side with your country.
questions.q39: It is important that the government follows the majority opinion, even if it is wrong.
questions.q40: The stronger the leadership, the better.
questions.q41: Democracy is more than a decision-making process.
questions.q43: A better world will come from automation, science, and technology.
questions.q44: Children should be educated in religious or traditional values.
questions.q45: Traditions are of no value on their own.
questions.q46: Religion should play a role in government.
questions.q47: Churches should be taxed the same way other institutions are taxed.
questions.q48: Climate change is currently one of the greatest threats to our way of life.
questions.q49: It is important that we work as a united world to combat climate change.
questions.q50: Society was better many years ago than it is now.
questions.q51: It is important that we maintain the traditions of our past.
questions.q52: It is important that we think in the long term, beyond our lifespans.
questions.q53: Reason is more important than maintaining our culture.
questions.q54: Drug use should be legalized or decriminalized.
questions.q56: No cultures are superior to others.
questions.q58: If we accept migrants at all, it is important that they assimilate into our culture.
questions.q59: Abortion should be prohibited in most or all cases.
questions.q60: Gun ownership should be prohibited for those without a valid reason.
questions.q64: To chase progress at all costs is dangerous.
questions.q65: Genetic modification is a force for good, even on humans.
questions.q66: We should open our borders to immigration.
questions.q67: Governments should be as concerned about foreigners as they are about their own citizens.
questions.q68: All people - regardless of factors like culture or sexuality - should be treated equally.
questions.q69: It is important that we further my group's goals above all others.
